description: A slim angled foregrip.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Ergonomic design provides a good degree of control over recoil.  This model is popular with special forces.

variants.description: A textured angled foregrip.  Popular with the U.S. special forces.  The finger shelves at the front, the middle, and the back help retain the grip, with a shallow grooved texture assisting along the main length.  <variant:black>

A textured angled foregrip.  Popular with the U.S. special forces.  The finger shelves at the front, the middle, and the back help retain the grip, with a shallow grooved texture assisting along the main length.  <variant:fde>

A textured angled foregrip.  Popular with the U.S. special forces.  The finger shelves at the front, the middle, and the back help retain the grip, with a shallow grooved texture assisting along the main length.  <variant:olive>

description: An angled foregrip with an exceptional amount of material removed.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Performs well against competition, while also saving on weight.

variants.description: A heavily-skeletonized angled grip.  The rough texture, while grippy, becomes uncomfortable on your skin after a while.  It's intended for a strap of paracord to latch onto.  <variant:black>
